answers.text:
Kansas uses STAR bonds.  There are a number of good examples with the Unified Governement of Kansas City and Wyandott County and the City of Hutchinson.  State legislature approved STAR bonds as part of the Tax Increment Financing statute.

answers.author: Kevin Baity
answers.text:
This past Spring, Illinois passed legislation for the use of STAR bonds. Unlike other States, Illinois only created one district in Marion (southern Illinois). The legislation was changed at the last minute from the metro East St Louis area after an organized group of local elected officials strongly opposed the project.  The Dept of Revenue which also opposed the legislation, is now saddled with writing the rules. They must also certify the district and approve the development. Although STAR bonds appear to have good intentions if applied statewide, the state legislature has put the surrounding communities at an unfair and competive disadvantage by creating only one district.
